commentary.line: That brings an end to the proceedings. The second ODI is coming up on Friday. Do join us for that game. Until then, this is Akshay Maanay signing off on behalf of Krishna and my co-commentators Pradeep, Sidhant Maheshwari and Raju. Goodnight and Cya!

Azhar Ali: "It was an outstanding effort from the batsmen. Hafeez gave us a good start. Haris (Soahil) and Malik continued the good work. The wickets are very good and it is tough for the bowlers. We have to adapt to the conditions and not give away many runs. I have been working hard on my batting. I try to go out and play fearless cricket and set an example for the team. We need to have the right balance between caution and aggression."

Malik: "I needed it. I was asked to bat at No. 5, but Waqar (Younis) and Mushtaq (Ahmed) came to me and told me to go at No. 4. So, that push helped me play well. I have been performing well in the domestic tournament, I have got a nice flow going on. Before I got selected, I have been playing Leagues all round the world, I want to play as an allrounder. I want to bowl and have been working hard on it. I am still in that learning process and hope I keep learning. I am honored to get this award. I would like to thank the people who backed me and those who didn't as well."
Shoaib Malik is the Man of the Match for his 76-ball 112 and one wicket.

Chigumbura: "I thought we applied ourselves well. But the last 7 overs didn't go our way to get the score. I am delighted with my knock, hopefully can get more in the next game. I thought we started well with the ball, but didn't execute the yorkers at the death. It was still a good wicket to bat on, it was important to score as many runs as possible."

Sean Williams looked scratchy during his brief stay at the crease and he fell after top-edging one to the keeper off Riaz. Chigumbura took a toll on Mohammad Sami as he smacked the Pakistani veteran for 22 runs in an over which included 3 sixes and a four. Chigumbura finally got out to a pacy full delivery from Wahab Riaz as he was forced to slog every ball while trying to reduce the required run rate. It was too difficult for the rest of the batsmen with the Pakistani bowlers keeping it tight towards the end. Zimbabwe had a day to forget barring the fact that they registered their highest ODI score (334/5) against a Test playing nation today.

Zimbabwe got off to a steady start as the openers played sensibly in the mandatory powerplay. Even though they lost both the openers in the space of five overs, Masakadza and skipper Chigumbura steadied the ship with a 124-run stand for the third wicket. Just when the partnership was looking dangerous, Masakadza threw his wicket away in quest of some quick runs. Chigumbura stayed on and ensured that he clobbered the freebies as he went on to register his maiden ODI ton.

It has been a happy outing for the hosts as they registered a comprehensive victory against Zimbabwe. Pakistan won the toss and elected to bat on a pitch which was flat and hard. Pakistan openers provided a great start which helped set a platform for the batsmen to follow. Shoaib Malik played a magnificent knock on his comeback as he registered his first century in six years. Pakistan managed to post a mammoth total as all the top four batters scored in excess of 75 runs.

49.6   Anwar Ali to Utseya, 2 runs, Pakistan win by 41 runs. Another off-speed delivery outside off, Utseya leans forward and caresses the drive wide of long-off, the fielder runs to his left and tidies up
49.5   Anwar Ali to Mutumbami, 1 run, yorker on off, Mutumbami brings his bat down and squeezes it to the vacant mid-wicket region

49.4   Anwar Ali to Mutumbami, FOUR, slower ball outside off, Mutumbami shuffles across, opens the bat face and steers it past the diving short third man fielder, the fast outfield takes care of the rest
49.3   Anwar Ali to Utseya, 1 run, good length ball on off, Utseya knocks it to cover and picks up a single
49.2   Anwar Ali to Utseya, no run, yorker on the stumps, Utseya digs it back to the bowler
49.1   Anwar Ali to Utseya, FOUR, boundary to start the final over, width on offer, Utseya throws his bat at that, slices it between backward point and short third man

48.6   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, bouncer to end his spell. Mutumbami sinks under it and allows the ball to sail through to Sarfraz. Riaz finishes with figures: 10-0-47-3. Another terrific effort from him on a flat track
48.6   Riaz to Mutumbami, wide, Riaz will have to reload, slips in the slower ball down leg, wide signalled by umpire Tiffin
48.5   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, drags the length back, Mutumbami taps it to backward point, straight to the fielder
48.4   Riaz to Utseya, 1 run, gives the charge to Riaz, who bowls it short, doesn't rise much, pulled to deep square leg
48.3   Riaz to Utseya, no run, back of a length around off, Utseya guides it to backward point, wanted the run but is sent back

48.2   Riaz to Utseya, FOUR, short ball aimed at the batsman, Utseya gets inside the line and goes for the pull, the ball takes the glove and flies to the left of the keeper, fine leg was square and he had no chance of stopping that
48.1   Riaz to Mutumbami, 1 run, shortish and outside off, Mutumbami rides the bounce and cuts to square third man
47.6   Anwar Ali to Mutumbami, 1 run, low full toss on off, Mutumbami whips it down to long-on and retains strike
47.5   Anwar Ali to Mutumbami, 2 runs, drops the slower ball short, Mutumbami pulls to deep mid-wicket, had enough time to come back for the second
47.4   Anwar Ali to Utseya, 1 run, yorker length on the stumps, Utseya squeezes it to long-on
47.3   Anwar Ali to Utseya, no run, change of pace, it was in the slot, Utseya was looking to send it into orbit, fails to make the required connection
47.2   Anwar Ali to Mutumbami, 1 run, fuller and just outside off, Mutumbami chips it on the bounce to long-off
47.1   Anwar Ali to Utseya, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Utseya mistimes the drive towards cover, easy single taken
Anwar Ali [8.0-0-63-1] is back into the attack
46.6   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, short and on leg-stump, Mutumbami ducks under it and evades it comfortably
Back over the wicket

46.6   Riaz to Mutumbami, wide, that must have slipped out of his hands, high full toss well wide of off, Mutumbami can't reach it, Sarfraz Ahmed doesn't glove it as well, but the duo don't risk a run
46.5   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, low full toss around off, Mutumbami drives and picks out mid-off

46.4   Riaz to Mutumbami, FOUR, Sami continues to have a horror day. Full toss outside off, Mutumbami goes hard at it, the ball takes the outside edge and rolls down to third man, Sami allows it to go through his legs. He fetches the ball back and shakes his head
Round the wicket
46.3   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, shortish and outside off, Mutumbami slaps it straight to extra cover
46.2   Riaz to Utseya, 1 run, too straight, on middle and leg, Utseya works it square of the wicket on the leg-side, for a single
46.1   Riaz to Utseya, no run, angled across off, Utseya drives and misses, just too good for the batsman
45.6   Sami to Mutumbami, no run, fullish and outside off, Mutumbami drives but this time finds the fielder at extra cover

45.5   Sami to Mutumbami, FOUR, fabulous shot! That brings up the 300 as well. Pitched up just outside off, Mutumbami leans forward and creams it wide of mid-off, the timing was excellent as the ball raced away to the fence
45.4   Sami to Utseya, 1 run, on a length just outside off, Utseya goes for the on-the-up drive, drags it to mid-on off the inner part of the bat
45.3   Sami to Utseya, no run, too full and on the stumps, almost a yorker, Utseya digs it out towards mid-wicket
45.2   Sami to Utseya, FOUR, Sami continues to leak runs. Short and not much venom on this delivery, Utseya swivels and pulls it behind square, split fine leg and deep backward square to perfection
45.1   Sami to Utseya, no run, short and rising on the batsman, Utseya defends off his gloves to short mid-wicket
44.6   Riaz to Utseya, 1 run, shortens the length and gets it to holds its line, Utseya is squared up as the outside edge goes wide of the slip fielder and down to third man
A wide slip in place
44.5   Riaz to Utseya, no run, slanted across the right-hander, Utseya has a slash and fails to make contact
Prosper Utseya, right handed bat, comes to the crease

44.4   Riaz to Chigumbura, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! A top innings from Chigumbura comes to an end. He takes the hopes of a Zimbabwe win along with him. Riaz is delighted. Good length ball, Chigumbura backs away and wanted to force it through the off-side, is beaten by the pace and the off-stump goes for a walk. Chigumbura b Riaz 117(95) [4s-10 6s-4]
Riaz to Chigumbura, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

44.3   Riaz to Mutumbami, 1 run, direct hit and Chigumbura would have been in trouble. Back of a length around off, Mutumbami taps it towards backward point, calls for a sharp run, Chigumbura responds and was short if the fielder had hit the bulls-eye
44.2   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, short and angled across the right hander, Mutumbami looks to glide it to third man, but is undone by the extra bounce

44.1   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, back of a length on middle and leg, Mutumbami gets inside the line and doesn't connect with the flick, wears it on the thigh pad, the ball dribbles to the on-side, wanted a single but is sent back

43.6   Sami to Chigumbura, SIX, third six of the over and Sami gives away 22 runs. This is unbelievable hitting. Short delivery, Chigumbura sits back and waits for it, pulls it over deep square leg, the fielder near the rope was a mere spectator

43.5   Sami to Chigumbura, FOUR, this is tremendous batting, Sami goes full, targets the stumps, Chigumbura drills it straight down the ground, long-on had no chance of stopping that, plenty of power behind that shot

43.4   Sami to Chigumbura, SIX, another massive six. This is some shot by the Zimbabwean skipper. Length delivery right in the slot, Chigumbura moves away to the leg-side and smashes it over wide long-on for the second six of the over
43.3   Sami to Chigumbura, no run, off-speed bumper, Chigumbura looks to ramp it over the keeper, can't make the required connection
43.2   Sami to Chigumbura, no run, slower short ball, Chigumbura is early into the pull, misses it by a distance

43.1   Sami to Chigumbura, SIX, what a moment! Chigumbura registers his maiden ODI hundred. He gets there in style. Raises his bat and takes his helmet. Soaks in the applause from the crowd and his team-mates. Coming to the ball, short and plenty of width on offer, Chigumbura cuts it up and over backward point, had enough legs to go the distance
Mohammad Sami [5.0-0-32-0] is back into the attack
42.6   Riaz to Mutumbami, no run, back of a length just outside off, Mutumbami stays back and knocks it down the wicket
42.5   Riaz to Mutumbami, 2 runs, short and just outside off, Mutumbami rides the bounce and cuts square of the wicket, the sweeper runs to his left and tidies up
42.4   Riaz to Chigumbura, 1 run, takes the pace off the ball, Chigumbura steers it to third man
42.3   Riaz to Chigumbura, no run, back of a length around off, Chigumbura mistimes the punch to mid-off

42.2   Riaz to Chigumbura, FOUR, edged and four. It was a ripper from Riaz, short and rising steeply, Chigumbura was hanging back trying to defend, the ball takes the shoulder and flies wide of the keeper
Richmond Mutumbami, right handed bat, comes to the crease

42.1   Riaz to Sean Williams, out Caught by Sarfraz Ahmed!! Riaz once again provides the breakthrough for Pakistan. And it is the short delivery that gives him yet another wicket. Williams goes for the pull, top-edges it high in the air and to the right of the keeper, Sarfraz Ahmed called for it and took it easily. Sean Williams c Sarfraz Ahmed b Riaz 36(28) [4s-5]
Riaz to Sean Williams, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Wahab Riaz [6.0-0-25-1] is back into the attack

41.6   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, FOUR, banged in halfway down the wicket, Chigumbura was expecting it, rocks back and muscles the pull towards deep mid-wicket, it just bounced before the ad cushions. Hafeez near the rope signalled four, but umpire Dar still went upstairs, just to be sure
41.5   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, too straight, on leg-stump, Williams whips it to deep square leg
41.4   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, 1 run, short delivery right at the batsman, Chigumbura tucks it awkwardly to mid-wicket, thinks about the second but settles with one as Anwar Ali tidies up himself
41.3   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, no run, another slower short ball outside off, Chigumbura goes for the upper cut, fails to connect with it
41.2   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, change of pace, Williams backs away and forces it to mid-off, quick single taken
41.2   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, wide, slower short ball down leg, Williams has nothing to do with it, wide given for line

41.1   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, FOUR, Anwar Ali has been extremely unlucky today. Excellent yorker, Williams squirts it off the outer half of the bat to third man, the fielder was inside the ring and was very square

40.6   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, SIX, that's a monstrous hit from the Zimbabwean skipper. Takes a couple of steps down the wicket for this flighted delivery, gets underneath it and sends it soaring over long-on for a maximum. That went a long way into the crowd
40.5   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, no run, shimmies down the wicket, gets to the pitch and drives to the right of the bowler, Malik puts his hand out and makes a fine stop
40.4   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, no run, stays round the wicket for Chigumbura, slows this up on leg-stump, Chigumbura misses the sweep and is struck on the kneeroll
40.3   Shoaib Malik to Sean Williams, 1 run, fired into the blockhole, Williams squeezes the drive to long-off
40.2   Shoaib Malik to Sean Williams, no run, down the track and plays the big hit, ekes out an inside edge onto the pad, the ball towards the keeper and Williams had to rush back

40.1   Shoaib Malik to Sean Williams, FOUR, lovely shot! Malik starts from round the wicket, tosses it up on off and middle, Williams kneels down and sweeps it over square leg, ball bounces a couple of times before reaching the fence
Shoaib Malik [3.0-0-22-1] is back into the attack
The batting powerplay yielded 40 runs. Zimbabwe need 136 runs in the last 10 overs.
39.6   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, too full and on the stumps, Williams whips it to mid-wicket, takes on Azhar Ali and makes it with ease
39.5   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, no run, fullish and close to off, Chigumbura stays leg-side of the ball and slices the drive to backward point, straight to the fielder, hence no single available
39.4   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, 1 run, Chigumbura is cramped for room with the back of a length delivery, defends awkwardly to the on-side, gets across to the other end
39.3   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, 2 runs, slower ball that is dragged short, Chigumbura pulls between deep mid-wicket and long-on, picks up two before the ball is hunted down
39.2   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, fuller and around off, Williams push-drives to mid-off, calls for a quick single and gets a good response from Chigumbura
39.1   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 2 runs, pitched up outside off, Williams drives it to deep extra cover, the sweeper had some ground to cover, that allows the batsmen to come back for the second
38.6   Riaz to Chigumbura, FOUR, pitched up and in the slot, Chigumbura plants his front foot and drives it handsomely to the deep extra cover fence
Riaz goes round the wicket
38.5   Riaz to Chigumbura, no run, short and wide of off, Chigumbura goes for a wild pull, misses it by a long way
38.4   Riaz to Chigumbura, no run, bumper right into the helmet grill, Chigumbura was hurried on the pull and misses, he wears it on the helmet grill and he is lucky that it didn't harm him
38.3   Riaz to Chigumbura, FOUR, short and angling away from the right hander, Chigumbura hangs back and cuts it uppishly square of the wicket
38.2   Riaz to Chigumbura, 2 runs, on a good length into middle and leg, Chigumbura swivels across and miscues the pull to deep square leg
38.1   Riaz to Sean Williams, 1 run, short delivery just outside off, this was slower as well, Williams yet again gets a top-edge on the pull and the ball rolls to third man
37.6   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, full delivery on the pads, Williams works it to deep mid-wicket and scampers for a single
37.5   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, FOUR, short ball just outside off, Williams top-edges the pull and the ball rolls towards the third man fence, lucky boundary for Williams
37.4   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, no run, full delivery just outside off, Williams drives it back to the bowler

37.3   Anwar Ali to Chigumbura, leg byes, 1 run, bumper just outside off, Chigumbura was looking to pull, he misses it by a long way, ball hits the shoulder and rolls to keeper who gets a bad bounce and concedes an extra
37.2   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Williams mistimes the pull to mid-wicket
37.1   Anwar Ali to Sean Williams, FOUR, poor first ball from Anwar Ali, back of a length on middle and leg, Williams sits back and helps it on its way behind square on the on-side
Anwar Ali [5.0-0-34-1] is back into the attack
36.6   Riaz to Chigumbura, no run, slower ball bouncer outside off, Chigumbura lets it go through to the keeper
36.5   Riaz to Sean Williams, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Williams cuts it to square of the wicket

36.4   Riaz to Chigumbura, 1 run, dropped, that's a dolly to Azam at deep square leg, another short delivery at the batsman, Chigumbura connects with pull and the ball goes straight to Azam who attempts a reverse cup, fails to hang onto it
36.3   Riaz to Chigumbura, no run, short delivery angling away from the right hander, Chigumbura plays the pull a day late and misses
36.2   Riaz to Sean Williams, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off, Williams guides it uppishly towards third man
36.1   Riaz to Chigumbura, 1 run, back of a length delivery around the hip, Chigumbura tucks it off the back foot towards square leg and gets an easy single
Wahab Riaz [4.0-0-10-1] is back into the attack

35.6   Hafeez to Sean Williams, FOUR, finally, Williams gets the boundary he was looking for. Straying onto leg-stump, Williams bends his knee, plays the sweep/pull over backward square, the fielder jumps but the ball eludes him
35.5   Hafeez to Sean Williams, no run, touch short and just outside off, Williams makes room and mistimes the cut to extra cover
35.4   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, down the wicket to meet the pitch of the ball, whipped on the bounce to deep mid-wicket
35.3   Hafeez to Chigumbura, no run, flighted close to off, Chigumbura push-drives to mid-off
35.2   Hafeez to Sean Williams, 1 run, Williams comes down the track, wrists it wide of long-on, wanted two but decides against it
35.1   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, starts from round the wicket, tossed up around off, Chigumbura drives to mid-off, the fielder dives to his right and makes a half stop
Time for the batting powerplay
34.6   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, once more on the leg-stump, Chigumbura works it in front of square and collects a single
34.5   Shoaib Malik to Sean Williams, 1 run, floated up outside off, Williams drags the loft to long-on
34.4   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, slower and on leg-stump, Chigumbura nudges it to mid-wicket

34.3   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, FOUR, bad delivery and Chigumbura latches onto it. Half tracker outside off, Chigumbura backs away and slaps it in front of square, wide of long-off and picks up four more
34.2   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, no run, goes round the wicket, angles it across off, punched to the right of the bowler
34.1   Shoaib Malik to Sean Williams, 1 run, Williams gives the charge to Malik, gets to the pitch and drills to long-on
33.6   Hafeez to Chigumbura, no run, sliding onto the pads, Chigumbura glances and finds short fine, straight to the fielder
33.5   Hafeez to Sean Williams, 1 run, eases the flighted delivery down to long-on, for a single
33.4   Hafeez to Sean Williams, no run, flatter and on leg-stump, Williams fails to connect with the flick, the ball gets stuck between his legs
33.3   Hafeez to Sean Williams, no run, takes a step out and mistimes the punch to the bowler
33.2   Hafeez to Sean Williams, no run, quicker and on off, Williams pushes it to cover
Round the wicket
33.1   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, Chigumbura works it behind square on the leg-side
32.6   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, drifting on the pads, Chigumbura works it away to deep backward square leg for a single
Sean Williams, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Time for a drinks break

32.5   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, out Caught by Azam!! Malik gets the big wicket of Masakadza. This was bowled quicker on the pads and Masakadza wanted to hit it over the deep mid-wicket fence, he gets the elevation on the hoick as he comes down the track but doesn't get the distance. Azam from deep mid-wicket runs forward and takes a simple catch. Masakadza walks back disappointed. H Masakadza c Azam b Shoaib Malik 73(73) [4s-4 6s-2]
Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
32.4   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, no run, tossed up on off, Masakadza defends it back to the bowler

32.3   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, SIX, that's been smashed! It was a freebie from Malik, full toss down the leg-side, Masakadza kneels down and slog sweeps it over the deep backward square leg fence
32.2   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, sweeps this quicker one to deep backward square leg

32.1   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 2 runs, comes down the track and converts it into a full toss, he hoicks it over mid-wicket but doesn't get the desired elevation or the distance. Luckily for him, the ball falls just short of the fielder charging in from deep mid-wicket, gets back for the second

31.6   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, dropped! This was bowled on middle and leg stump line, Chigumbura goes slightly across and hoicks it straight towards mid-wicket, where Shafiq gets both hands on the ball, but he somehow can't hold on. The ball escapes to the deep and the batsmen take a single. That was hit hard by Chig and went fast to the fielder
31.5   Hafeez to Chigumbura, no run, pushes this delivery on middle stump line to the right of the bowler, who quickly moves across and stops the ball
31.4   Hafeez to Chigumbura, no run, quicker and on the pads, Chigumbura can't tuck it away into the on-side and wears it on the pad, it was going down leg though
Goes back over the wicket
31.3   Hafeez to H Masakadza, 1 run, kneels down and sweeps this quicker delivery straight to the man at deep backward square leg
31.2   Hafeez to H Masakadza, SIX, that's been tonked! This was flighted on middle stump line, Masakadza steps out of the crease and launches it over the deep mid-wicket fence for a maximum
31.1   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, Chigu gets to his 19th ODI fifty with this single, it was flatter and on the stumps, Chigumbura punches it down to long-on
30.6   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, drifting on the pads, worked away through backward square leg for a single

30.5   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, no run, in the air and just short! This was tossed up on the stumps from round the wicket, Chigumbura looks to work it away into the on-side, closes the bat face a little too early and gets a leading edge, the ball was in the air for sometime but falls just short of the fielder at cover, who was charging in towards the ball
30.4   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, 1 run, on middle and leg stump line, Masakadza knocks it through mid-on and gets to the other end
30.3   Shoaib Malik to Chigumbura, 1 run, punches this quicker delivery on off down to long-off for a single
30.2   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, 1 run, employs the reverse sweep but fails to connect with it properly, the ball rolls away towards the short third man region and the batsmen take a single
30.1   Shoaib Malik to H Masakadza, no run, flatter around off, Masakadza bunts it towards extra cover
Shoaib Malik, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
29.6   Hafeez to Chigumbura, no run, straighter one outside off, Chigumbura was playing for the turn there as he pushed at it, the ball goes past the outside edge
29.5   Hafeez to H Masakadza, 1 run, on middle and leg, Masakadza chips it to the right of mid-wicket, who can't reach it. The batsmen take a single

29.4   Hafeez to H Masakadza, no run, comes down the track and converts this full delivery into a full toss, drills it back to the bowler, who jumps and parries it towards mid-wicket with his right hand
29.3   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, once again bowls this one on the pads, Chigumbura works it through mid-wicket for a single
29.2   Hafeez to H Masakadza, 1 run, 100-run partnership comes up with this single, drifting on middle and leg, Masakadza flicks it through square leg and gets to the other end
29.1   Hafeez to H Masakadza, no run, works this flighted delivery on middle stump line towards mid-wicket, who dives to his right and prevents the single
28.6   Sami to H Masakadza, 1 run, Sami drags his length back outside off, Masakadza stays on the back foot and guides it to third man
28.5   Sami to H Masakadza, no run, Sami errs in line yet again, short of length and sliding down leg, Masakadza was looking to help it on its way, can't beat the diving short fine leg
28.4   Sami to Chigumbura, 1 run, on a length and slinging into middle and leg, Chigumbura tucks it to mid-wicket
28.3   Sami to Chigumbura, FOUR, three in three for Zimbabwe, this was full and just outside off, Chigumbura drives off the front foot and beats the diving mid-off, into the extra cover fence
28.2   Sami to Chigumbura, FOUR, short and wide again, Chigumbura stays on the back foot and cuts it to the deep backward point fence
28.1   Sami to Chigumbura, FOUR, poor delivery first up from Sami, delivers it short and wide, Chigumbura cuts it uppishly over point and gets a four
Mohammad Sami [4.0-0-18-0] is back into the attack

27.6   Hafeez to H Masakadza, FOUR, that's been nicely played. It was floated up, Masakadza kneels down and employs the reverse sweep, sends it through backward point and the ball runs away to the fence in no time
27.5   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, drifting on the pads this time, Chigumbura flicks it behind square on the on-side for a single
27.4   Hafeez to H Masakadza, 1 run, slightly flatter this time around, Masakadza bunts it down to long-off and gets to the other end
27.3   Hafeez to Chigumbura, 1 run, drives this flighted delivery down to long-off for another run

27.2   Hafeez to H Masakadza, 1 run, uppish and safe! Masakadza gets to his 27th ODI fifty with this single. It was tossed up outside off, Masakadza drives it in the air through the vacant mid-off region for a single

Here are some highlights of Pakistan's innings:
This is the second time where all the top four Pakistani batters have scored in excess of 50 runs.
Shoaib Malik's 70-ball century is also the second fastest century at Lahore.
375/3 is also the highest team total at Lahore in ODIs.

It will be a huge task for the visitors to chase this down. However, they showed some fight in the T20s. It will be interesting to see how the chase goes. Stay tuned for Zimbabwe's response in a short while.

Pakistan skipper, Azhar Ali, departed after scoring 79 while Hafeez was bowled by Utseya. Malik and Sohail spent ample time in the middle to get used to the conditions. Once they were set, they smashed the Zimbabwean bowlers all over the park. Shoaib Malik reached his 8th century and played some delightful strokes during his brilliant knock. It took 6 years and 31 innings for the veteran to reach his 8th ton. Haris Sohail also played a superb knock as he gave good support to Malik. As a result, Pakistan posted a mammoth total and ensured that they are in the driver's seat to win this game.

After 6 long years, ODIs have made a return to Pakistan and they couldn't have asked for a better start to proceedings. Pakistan opted to bat and they made full use of the conditions. The openers got them off to the best of starts as Hafeez and Azhar Ali put on a 170-run stand for the first wicket. Although the opening duo played cautiously for the first eight overs, they shifted gears later on as they kept punishing the hapless Zimbabwean pacers. Zimbabwe's bowlers kept bowling poor lengths and paid the price for doing so.

Nonetheless, it was a great knock from Malik on his comeback in the ODI team. Shoaib Malik c H Masakadza b Panyangara 112(76) [4s-12 6s-2]

The players are out in the middle.. Chigumbura leads the Zimbabwe team huddle. All set for the first ODI in Pakistan after 24th February, 2009.
Pitch Report: 'There is a little bit of grass, but it's straw coloured, shouldn't worry the batsmen one bit. Win the toss and bat first. There's plenty of runs on this surface,' reckons Rameez Raja.
Teams:

Zimbabwe (Playing XI): Hamilton Masakadza, Sikandar Raza, Vusi Sibanda, Sean Williams, Craig Ervine, Richmond Mutumbami(w), Elton Chigumbura(c), Prosper Utseya, Brian Vitori, Chris Mpofu, Tinashe Panyangara
Pakistan (Playing XI): Mohammad Hafeez, Azhar Ali(c), Haris Sohail, Shoaib Malik, Asad Shafiq, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Hammad Azam, Anwar Ali, Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Sami, Yasir Shah
Pakistan have won the toss and have opted to bat

While the series is historic and significant from different perspectives, it's also important for the hosts to complete a 3-0 whitewash over the tourists. Pakistan are ranked nine at the moment in the ICC ODI rankings and desperately need points to finish amongst the top eight - to have a chance to play in the 2017 edition of the Champions Trophy. The cut-off date for that tourney is September 30th and Pakistan have just one more series after this (against Sri Lanka) to secure enough points needed for qualification.

Pakistan are playing an ODI for the first time at home since 24th January, 2009. It has been more than six years that the Pakistan crowd has seen 50-over action on home soil. Lahore was the last home ODI venue for Pakistan, against Sri Lanka. The players have longed for home comfort and it's that stadium once again which welcomes back its heroes. Pakistan eased past Zimbabwe in the T20I series, but there's more at stake in the three match ODI series. Hello, and a warm welcome to one and all for the first ODI between Pakistan and Zimbabwe in Lahore.
